title: Normal homomorphism
summary: In algebra, a normal homomorphism is a ring homomorphism R → S {\displaystyle R\to S} that is flat and is such that for every field extension L of the residue field κ ( p ) {\displaystyle \kappa ({\mathfrak {p}})} of any prime ideal p {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {p}}} , L ⊗ R S {\displaystyle L\otimes _{R}S} is a normal ring.
